Title: the roommate transmogrification

Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is talking to Amy on webcam.
Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard enters, and accidentally sits on Raj. Both exclaim.
Raj’s apartment. Leonard and Priya are kissing.
Leonard’s bedroom. Raj and Penny are in bed.
The living room. Leonard is asleep on the couch.
Penny: Hey, you guys ready to order?
Okay, Priya?
Oh!
Wow, so that means you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, you’re a doctor, and Howard, you know a lot of doctors.
Yeah, just a heads-up on the car window deal. It helps, but everything is not peachy.
Thanks. Wow! What’s with the fancy spread?
What do you mean, new roommate? What happened to Leonard?
All right, let me try this again. Where’s Leonard?
Woah, Leonard and Priya are living together? That’s big.
Oh, no, no, no. I’ve had way too much already.
Hit me.
Monkeys.
When a suitcase just won’t do.
Okay, explain something to me. You watch Leonard put up with that guy for years and years. What has to break inside your brain for you to think, Oh, Krishna, I’ve got to get me some of that?
What? Oh, God, yeah. Yeah. Leonard’s a noisy little dude in the sack.
Really? Even during allergy season, when he has to alternate between kissing and breathing?
Yeah. Sorry, sorry. Can I tell you a secret?
I screwed up. Leonard’s a great guy. Never should have broken up with him.
Oh, you poor baby.
Nothing, nothing. You know, if we weren’t friends, and you hadn’t brought up that creepy pornography story, I’d be on you like the speed of light squared on matter to make energy.
I listen. I have no idea what it means, but I listen. To friendship.
Oh. It’s, it’s not what it looks like.
Howard: Uh..
You gotta like this, the girlfriend and the ex-girlfriend bonding over your rooty-tooty stinky booty.
Congratulations, honey.
Please, this isn’t about me. I’m proud of you.
What?
Better than what you’ve got a buttload of.
Hey, what’s up?
No, Ma! It’s Raj!
Yes!
Sheldon, yes! Everybody’s a doctor but me!
What’s up?
Sure, but I’m going out with Bernadette. It’ll just be you and my mother.
Ma, can Rajesh sleep over?!
I don’t know, she’s pretty feisty since they put her on hormone-replacement therapy.
Why?
Yeah, ha-ha. First of all, I’m not threatened by my fiancée’s success. I’m proud of her. And secondly, I have my own career.
So do you know what kind of research you’ll be doing at this pharmaceutical company?
Oh, Bernie, no. You didn’t have to.
You bought me a Rolex? How much did this cost?
I’ve been up all night. I had a fight with Bernadette.
She gave me a beautiful watch.
Leonard: Sure
Oh, no, no, no, he doesn’t.
Well, you have milk in the taters, milk in the gravy, parmesan crust. Your lactose-intolerant boyfriend will turn into a gas-filled Macy’s Day balloon.
So, no, on the Shepherd’s Pie. Can we move on?
Sea bass. I’ll have the sea bass.
Kill me.
So, what’s your news, Bernadette?
So, Howard, tell us, how’s it feel knowing that when you two get married, you’ll be referred to as Mr. and Dr. Wolowitz?
Bernadette, that’s great. Howard, do you make a buttload?
Hey, if I roll down the windows in the car, everything’s peachy. If you do it, you’re still not a doctor.
What are you doing here?
In my bed?
Oh, you heard?
Sorry. Does Sheldon know you’re sleeping in here?
Oh, yeah. Mouth-to-Mouth Mona. You know, she used to date Howard?
We tried. She doesn’t get along with Sheldon.
Okay, well, how about this. Until Priya gets her own place, you stay here and I’ll stay at your apartment.
You? Sure. Bring as many as you want.
Just not against their will.
Do you really think you should be eating that cake?
If you’re gonna be a trophy husband for a rich wife, you might want to watch your waistline.
Until you have kids.
There’s a reciprocity clause. You get to pull the plug on him, too.
Bring a ball or a Frisbee, you know, something he can chase.
No backsies.
Mmm. Mmm.
Sorry.
Oh, come on! Why don’t we just tell them that we’re dating?
When is the time?
Fine.
You’re moving back to India?
When were you going to tell me about this?
She’s lying because she doesn’t want you to know we’re dating.
Well, what difference does it make? If you’re moving back to India, we’re obviously breaking up.
So. Hot in India?
Uh. That is a beautiful tapestry.
What?
I live here.
Priya’s going back to India.
Yes.
What’s going on?
Priya: Uh, I’ll have the Shepherd’s Pie. You want to split that with me?
Leonard, sweetheart, we’re kissing, not eating hot soup.
Oh, we’ve been through this. It’s not the time.
I’ve got five brothers and sisters. One of them is bound to screw up real big, and then I’ll tell my parents about you. Now, shoo.
Oh, hello, Leonard. What a pleasant surprise! Mummy, Daddy, you remember Rajesh’s friend Leonard.
You know what? I don’t want to deal with this right now.
Sheldon: Not quite accurate. The Macy’s balloons are filled with helium, whereas Leonard produces copious amounts of methane.
It wouldn’help. The human body is capable of being flatulent for hours after death.
Bernadette, before you change the subject, does anyone have any final comments on Leonard’s faulty digestive system?
Oh, congratulations.
Unless he takes Bernadette’s last name. And considering her advanced status, that could open some doors for him.
I must say, Amy, I was very impressed to see that Bernadette got her PhD.
Your doctorate is in neurobiology. I fail to see the distinction.
It’s a little stiff. What a remarkably fragile structure to support such a valuable payload. Not unlike balancing a Faberge egg on a Pixie Stick.
I’d like to respond to that sarcastically. Yes, I relish the thought of a stranger covering my body with oil and rubbing it.
Still sounds like a lot of unnecessary touching.
All right.
Rotating.
You mean the myofascial point?
Oh, dear Lord, yes, yes, oh, yes! Amy, I’ve never been touched like this before! Oh! Oh, my hands are magic!
There’s someone at my door.
Why?
I can see how that would be upsetting. Come in. I’ll get the sheets and blankets for the couch.
No, I can’t authorize that.
The Hammurabic Code is an eye for an eye, not a bed for a bed.
All right. This is a form indemnifying me from your use of Leonard’s bedroom. Sign here, indicating that I tried to stop you and did so using a stern facial expression.

Wait. Not yet. We still have to go over safety procedures. Now, the apartment has three emergency exits located here, here, and here. In the event of a power outage, luminous paint will guide you to the nearest exit.
I never kid about safety.
Good news, Raj. I got the blood work back from the lab. You’re okay to stay for a while.
Not important. Your sugar was a little high. I’d follow up with your regular physician. In the meantime, I have some paperwork here for you to go over.
Boilerplate stuff. A modified roommate agreement for a temporary house guest. And a living will and durable power of attorney.
As your friend, let’s hope it doesn’t come to that. Please sign.

Congratulations and welcome temporarily aboard. Here’s your I.D. Card, your key and your lapel pin. Which Leonard was too cool to wear. FYI, part of your responsibilities as roommate pro tem will be to drive me to and from work, the comic book store, the barbershop and the park for one hour every other Sunday for fresh air.

Also, you’re tasked with bringing home all takeout dinners. Tonight is Thai food. You’ll find the standard order in appendix B or downloadable from my FTP server. If you have any questions, here’s the FAQ sheet, or if you prefer the human touch, I do a live web chat called Apartment Talk on Tuesday nights.
What is this?
Remarkable. I’m just realizing how much Leonard’s been skating by all these years.
Yes, it’s “Penny, get your own Wi-Fi.” No spaces.
My new roommate is bending over backwards to ingratiate himself to me. (Pointing to lapel badge) Uh, nice touch, by the way.
The same thing that happened to Homo Erectus. He was replaced by a superior species.
You’re living here provisionally. But I must say it’s looking good.
No. Origami napkin swans, that’s the headline.
Here’s an interesting fact about alcohol.
Man is not the only species that ferments fruit in order to become intoxicated. Can you guess what the other is? Hint, sometimes they pack the alcohol in their trunks.
When does a monkey have a trunk?

Mmm, all right. It would appear as if alcohol is playing keep-away with your intelligence. Good night. Please note, it is now past ten p.m. Per our roommate agreement, kindly refrain from raucous laughter, clinking of glasses, and celebratory gunfire.
What are you doing here?
I said, what are you doing here?
I have paperwork that says differently.
Irrelevant. Rajesh and I have a good thing going and you’re not going to ruin it. (Knock on door) What are you doing here?
Why?
Leonard, do you understand this?
Talk to him.
What does it look like?
Penny: Yeah, a little tip: he says he can eat frozen yoghurt. Do not believe it.
Bernadette: Guys, sorry I’m late. I have amazing news.
The thesis committee accepted my doctoral dissertation. I’m getting my PhD.
Well, you’ll be really be proud of this. I was headhunted by a big pharmaceutical company. They’re gonna pay me a buttload of money!

Well, there are a couple of opportunities available, but I volunteered for the premature ejaculation project. I mean, it’s not like either one of us has heart disease. Oh, I almost forgot. I got you a little present.
I wanted to. Come on, open it.
Oh, you let me worry about the money. I just want my baby to have pretty things.
Raj (earphones in, singing): Oh, if there was a problem, you can’t solve it, check out the hook while my DJ revolves it. Ice, Ice, baby. Ice, Ice, baby. (Removes headphones and goes to refrigerator).
Priya (off): Oh, God, I feel ridiculous in this dress.
Shh, my brother’s going to hear you.
I can’t believe I’m wearing my brother’s Halloween costume.
Leonard (off): You look beautiful, Lieutenant Uhura. Now prepare for inspection.
Relax, he’s got headphones on. And we’re ten miles above Earth in a starship.
I can’t believe you think he only wears it on Halloween. Open the landing bay doors, shuttle craft approaching.
Raj: Really, ten miles? You’re orbiting inside the atmosphere? Moron.
Okay, gotta go.
Leonard’s putting disgusting memories in my memory foam mattress. Can I stay here tonight?
I guess that’s okay.
She’s kidding, right?
Leonard’s having astronomically inaccurate Star Trek sex with my sister.
Oh, don’t bother. I’ll just sleep in Leonard’s room.
Well, he’s in my bed. Why can’t I be in his?
Come on, dude, I’m exhausted, and Tyra Banks says the most important item in your makeup bag is a good night’s sleep.
Good night, Sheldon.
You’re kidding.
I was sleeping.
Well, I would’ve slept in my own bed, but it was being used to bring shame to my family. And the memory of Gene Roddenberry.
Scotty, I need more power.
Are you kidding? He made me sign a waiver, participate in an emergency fire drill and take a refresher course in CPR. Thank God he had a dummy.
Oh, my God, she’s that Mona? Why can’t you and my sister spend your nights here?
Sheldon doesn’t get along with Sheldon. It’s still no reason for me to have to listen to you arm your photon torpedoes every night.
Can I bring girls here?
Okay, deal.
He’s right. A minute on the lips, a lifetime on the hips.
When did you take my blood?
What the hell is this?
This says you can make end of life decisions for me.
Did you sign this?
Well, that seems fair.
Sheldon, dinner!
This is the difference between eating and dining.
It’s not a big thing. Just think of me as a brown Martha Stewart.
I’m the new Homo in town. That came out wrong.
He’s living at my place, so I’m living here.
It’s a good thing.
More wine?
Well, it’s a lot better than having to wear noise-cancelling headphones in my own apartment.
Every night.
It’s my sister. Can we not talk about this any more?
Yeah.
Well, uh, to paraphrase Shakespeare, It’s better to have loved and lost than to stay home every night and download increasingly shameful pornography.
What’s wrong with me, Penny?
Hey, you totally got that right! E equals M C squared.
To friendship.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): Is that my future daughter-in-law, the doctor?
Like Leonard and the skinny weirdo!
Of course, he and I can play doctor!
Amy: It’s indeed admirable. Although, it is microbiology.

I’ll make it simple for you. I study the brain, the organ responsible for Beethoven’s Fifth Symphony. Bernadette studies yeast, the organism responsible for Michelob Lite. Is there something wrong with your neck?
I was proposing you massage your muscles with your own hands.
Trust me. With your right hand, locate the spot where the scapula meets the acromion process.
Now push your third finger along the ridge of the shoulder blade, making a small rotation as you do so.
You should feel a small node-like object rolling back and forth along the bone.
Obviously. Now bear down on it like the seventh grade noogies we all know too well.
Don’t flatter yourself. Your hands are blunt tools guided by my knowledge of the nervous system. I could just as easily have paralyzed you.
Penny (at door): Hey, Sheldon, did you change your Wi-Fi password again?
Sheldon (off): Would you booze hounds please stop that infernal clinking? And the answer was elephant!
Priya (computer tone): That’s my parents on video chat. Go hide in the bedroom.
Dr Koothrappali: We heard there was a tornado in Kansas City. Is that close to you?
I don’t like it, a young girl alone in an apartment.
I thought you said Rajesh was out with his friends.
Of course it is. It always is. It’s India. Now, what do you have to say for yourself?
Mrs Koothrappali: I’ll sleep so much better when you move back here next month.
Oh, my God! There’s someone in your apartment. Call the police in America!
Why are you lying to us?
Penny (waking up): Oh, God. Oh, God! Oh. Okay, look. This never happened. Do you understand me? (Raj nods) Really? Still can’t talk to me?
